definition: to digress/to stray from the subject
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Ti
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Put details and digressions in footnotes. Then delete the footnotes.
sentences.chinese: 把細節和離題的東西放到腳註，然後刪除腳註。

sentences.english: By my rambling digressions I perceive myself to be grown old.
sentences.chinese: 依我絮叨離題的程度來看，我知道我的確老了。

sentences.english: I usually become digressive when I am exhausted or bored.
sentences.chinese: 通常我疲憊厭倦時，就會離題。

sentences.english: But I digress, onto Matt's woods.
sentences.chinese: 我離題了，我們還是說說馬特的森林吧。

sentences.english: They are a little impatient at her digression.
sentences.chinese: 他們對她離題的話顯得有點不耐煩。

sentences.english: I'll tell you a funny story,if I may digress from my subject for a monent.
sentences.chinese: 如果允許我離題一會兒，我就給你們講個有趣的故事。

sentences.english: The discussion trailed off into futilities.
sentences.chinese: 討論離題越來越遠，變成了空談。

sentences.english: Or maybe they will return to flame him. But I digress.
sentences.chinese: 有或者他們會返回去熱烈擁護他，但我離題了。

sentences.english: His answer was wide of the mark.
He never stepped aside when he explained some things.
sentences.chinese: 他在說明問題時，他的談話從不離題。

sentences.english: Weve gone too far off the point. Lets return to the topic under discussion.
sentences.chinese: 咱們離題太遠了，還是回到正題上來吧。

sentences.english: But stretch a topic too far and usually it will collapse into irrelevancy.
sentences.chinese: 但若是擴展太遠，往往因爲離題而寫出失敗的文章。

sentences.english: A thousand words from the pen in a stream, but ten thousand li away from the subject.

definition: to pass over/to skip
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
in a few words (idiom); expressed succinctly
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to say good-bye/to bid sb farewell
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
section/fragment/segment
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
to have nothing to say (idiom)
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
modal particle
to force someone to do something
to be gravely mistaken (idiom)
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
